intro: Alsine moehringia, commonly known as narrowleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clustered flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Alsine moehringia is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
